intro: Oldenlandia laceyi, commonly known as the lacey spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Oldenlandia laceyi is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in partial shade with well-drained soil.
